title: WEB 3
body:
## Table of Content

* **Introduction**
* **What is WEB3**
  * Why is WEB3 important?
* **WEB3 Applications**
  * DeFi
  * NFT
  * DAO
* **WEB3 Growth in Numbers**
  * DeFi
  * NFT
* **Business Use Cases**
* **Conclusion**

## Introduction

In this post, which I will talk about WEB3 Applications, I would say that you don't have to know nothing specific to blockchain to understand the it all. On the end of the day WEB3 applications will evolve to a point that they will be transparent to end users, which means they could easily be used my majority of people without any specific previous knowledge. This is the only way the the mass audience will be reached and my mission here is to help get to this stage.

I just would like to mention that, as shown on previous post, WEB3 is possible due to the technology emerged by Ethereum: automated actions coded on Blockchain (Smart Contracts). The main most popular applications so far are related to finance and authentication and here is our start point.

## What is WEB3?

**Simple answer:** Instead of an internet monopolized by large technology companies, Web3 embraces decentralization and is being built, operated, and owned by its users. **Web3 puts power in the hands of individuals rather than corporations.**

### Why is WEB3 important?

Just like Industrial Revolution, the WEB has been through different stages throughout its history. Let's take a look in how we got here in order to understand why WEB3:

**Web 1.0: Read-Only (1990-2004)**

The first drafts of the internet had the intention to create open and decentralized protocols that allowed information-sharing from anywhere on Earth. The actual main results were **static websites owned by companies and there was close to zero interaction between users**, since individuals seldom produced content, leading to it being known as the read-only web.

**Web 2.0: Read-Write (2004-now)**

The Web 2.0 period began in 2004 with the emergence of social media platforms. **Instead of only companies providing content to users, the users also began to provide platforms to share user-generated content and engage in user-to-user interactions.** As more people came online, a handful of top companies began to control a disproportionate amount of the traffic and value generated on the web. **Web 2.0 also birthed the advertising-driven revenue model**. While users could create content, they didn't own it or benefit from its monetization.

**Web 3.0: Read-Write-Own**

The idea of WEB3 was created by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood. He put into words a solution for a problem that many early crypto adopters felt: the internet required too much trust. That is, most of the internet that people know and use today relies on trusting a handful of private companies to act in the public's best interests. **At its core, Web3 uses blockchain's trust value to create applications that give power back to the users in the form of ownership.** The network gives ownership to users by being:

* **Decentralized:** instead of large swathes of the internet controlled and owned by centralized entities, ownership gets distributed amongst its builders and users.
* **Permissionless**: everyone has equal access to participate in Web3, and no one gets excluded.
* **Embedded with native payments:** it uses cryptocurrency for spending and sending money online instead of relying on the outdated infrastructure of banks and payment processors.
* **Trustless:** it operates using incentives and economic mechanisms instead of relying on trusted third-parties.

## WEB 3 Applications

Now that you understand the core values of WEB3, it is now possible to understand what solutions are being built with based on these principles.

### DeFi

**De**centralized **Fi**nance is the term used to dapps (decentralized applications) built to provide financial solutions. With DeFi, the markets are always open and there are no centralized authorities who can block payments or deny you access to anything. Services that were previously slow and at risk of human error are automatic and safer now that they're handled by code that anyone can inspect and scrutinize.

Here is a quick comparison between traditional finance and DeFi:

![Source: https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#defi-comparison](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V7z56Yvm5vU8yjsiCj2EK.png?height=412&width=960)

Due to the logic that can be created on Smart Contracts, financial institutions can be removed from the equation. A contract that's designed to hand out an allowance or pocket money could be programmed to send money from Account A to Account B every Friday. And it will only ever do that as long as Account A has the required funds. No one can change the contract and add Account C as a recipient to steal funds.

There's a decentralized alternative to most financial services and also financial products that are completely new created due to blockchain capabilities. This is an ever-growing list:

* [Send money around the globe](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#send-money)
* [Stream money around the globe](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#stream-money)
* [Access stable currencies](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#stablecoins)
* [Borrow funds with collateral](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#lending)
* [Borrow without collateral](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#flash-loans)
* [Start crypto savings](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#saving)
* [Trade tokens](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#swaps)
* [Grow your portfolio](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#investing)
* [Fund your ideas](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#crowdfunding)
* [Buy insurance](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#insurance)
* [Manage your portfolio](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#aggregators)

To understand better the how it works and the players involved in DeFi, you can separate the environment into 4 layers:

1. The blockchain – Ethereum contains the transaction history and state of accounts.
2. The assets – [ETH](https://ethereum.org/en/eth/) and the other tokens (currencies).
3. The protocols – [smart contracts](https://ethereum.org/en/glossary/#smart-contract) that provide the functionality, for example a service that allows for decentralized lending of assets.
4. [The applications](https://ethereum.org/en/dapps/) – the products we use to manage and access the protocols.

### NFT

**N**on-**F**ungible **T**okens are tokens running in a specific compatible blockchain that have an **infungible** format and that **allows to have some kind of media on their content**. Their goal is to represent the ownership of unique items and currently they are commonly used to represent digital collectibles.

* **Infungible**

  Cryptocurrencies are tokens created in a fungible format that allows the exchange of a cryptocurrency by the same cryptocurrency. For example a bitcoin that could be exchanged to any other bitcoin and both leave with the same value.

  For a Non-Fungible asset you don't have an exact pair of it that could be considered the exact same value (they can be similar values) because of different characteristics it carries. Making a parallel to houses, two very similar houses don't have the same exact value due to due to different characteristics, such as previous owners, condition of the house, etc.
* **Media carry**

  One of the NFTs properties is that it allows us *tokenise* things like art, collectibles, even real estate. Along with that, it can only have one official owner at a time and they're secured by the running blockchain, which means no one can modify the record of ownership or copy/paste a new NFT into existence.

![Overview of a NFT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vqpxZwbZsDpTh-PE5NGfY.png?height=352&width=539)

**The value of a NFT**

We are entering the transition to the era where we value assets more digital assets than physical assets (and this is called the Metaverse). You don't have to think about virtual lands to understand that, but instead think about how you value your cellphones, how gamers value skins within games, etc.

When it comes to copying digital content available on the internet for free instead of buying something, remember that value is subjective. If you were offered replica of Mona Lisa's painting for free, would you feel it has the same value as the original one? Just like Mona Lisa's painting, the value of an NFT goes beyond the media: there are labels of creator, current owner and market history.

It is also important to understand that NFTs are not just used as scarce assets, but also they can be used as utility items to develop a variety of business models. For example: holding a specific NFT allows you to buy clothes for a cheaper price, have access to a specific clothing collection, attend to private events, etc. Below it is listed some examples of use cases:

* [Digital content](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nfts-for-creators)
* [Gaming items](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nft-gaming)
* [Domain names](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nft-domains)
* [Physical items](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nft-physical-items)
* [Investments and collateral](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nfts-and-defi)

### DAO

**D**ecentralized **A**utonomous **O**rganizations are groups organized in a democratic way that allows members to directly vote into the group decisions by proposals and ensure everyone in the organization has a voice. 

Being straight forward, its goal is to be a company with a decentralized modus operandi. They are able to do that due to **Smart Contract capabilities** of creating built-in treasuries that no one has the authority to access without the approval of the group. There's no CEO who can authorize spending based on their own whims and no chance of a dodgy CFO manipulating the books. Everything is out in the open and the rules around spending are baked into the DAO via its code.

There are different models for DAO membership, with different voting mechanisms and other key parts:

* **Token-based membership**

  Simply holding a specific token grants access to voting. Depending on each project, to earn a token you can get on decentralized marketplaces or through liquidity provisioning or some other “proof-of-work”.

  Typically used to govern broad decentralized protocols and/or tokens themselves.
* **Share-based membership**

  Any prospective members can submit a proposal to join the DAO, usually offering a tribute of some value in the form of tokens or work. Shares represent direct voting power and ownership and members can exit at any time with their proportionate share of the treasury.

  Typically used for more closer-knit, human-centric organizations like charities, worker collectives, and investment clubs. Can also govern protocols and tokens as well.
* **Reputation-based membership**

  Reputation represents proof of participation and grants voting power in the DAO. Unlike token or share-based membership, reputation-based DAOs don't transfer ownership to contributors. Reputation cannot be bought, transferred or delegated; DAO members must earn reputation through participation. On-chain voting is permissionless and prospective members can freely submit proposals to join the DAO and request to receive reputation and tokens as a reward in exchange for their contributions.

  Typically used for decentralized development and governance of protocols and dApps, but also well suited to a diverse set of organizations like charities, worker collectives, investment clubs, etc.

If in one hand you have the visibility and system that prevents robbery, on the other hand you have open sensible data that companies would rather let it private. If in one hand you have people in the whole company having voice on companies decisions, on the other hand you have decisions that are better to be made by senior managers instead of a democratic voting of non-specialized people. 

This new way of organizing companies is a new paradigm and lots of discussions happen in this way. The creator of Ethereum himself writes a lot about this topic on his [personal blog](https://vitalik.ca/index.html). 

## WEB3 Growth in Numbers

Below I provide some links to internet available charts related to WEB3 statistics.

### DeFi

* DeFi Users Over Time (Ethereum)

![https://dune.com/queries/2972/5739](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O1OYmbKIFVWJuLDdArnBM.png?height=332&width=1884)

* Decentralized Exchangers Metrics

![https://dune.com/hagaetc/dex-metrics](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yKWQyf7RiwVq_yyKjKCjt.png?height=483&width=1884)

### NFT

* OpenSea Users Over Time (Ethereum)

![https://dune.com/rchen8/opensea](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OAiKA2eqybIVcp2LnZLMO.png?height=382&width=933)

## Business Use Cases

WEB3 is not the only thing emerging based on blockchain technology; [traditional markets](https://www.blockdata.tech/blog/general/81-of-the-top-100-public-companies-are-using-blockchain-technology) are also taking advantage of this. They are reinventing their business by not only adapting to WEB3 solutions, such as DeFi, but also by creating value with blockchain core capabilities. Among several applications that are being developed, I would like to highlight [SAP's solution green-token](https://www.green-token.io/).

Green Token by SAP is a system that enhances companies efforts on tracking production chain and is able to determine whether it was produced with the sustainable characteristics desired. By applying **NFT principles into the logistics system**, it is possible to track each phase of production chain on production supplier. It not only helps with the conscious consumption of people and with the trust between companies and their suppliers, but also enables a faster and cheaper way to audit reporting and fixing issues along the production chain.

## Conclusion

WEB3 is slowly being incremented in people's lives and being braked by current world economic scenario with high inflation and high interest rates. Since high interest rates tend to puncture bubbles, it will be interesting seeing many outstanding solutions overcome this period, increasing people's confidence in them, and many other solutions disappear, proving to be a bubble. In the general WEB3 scenario, I think that this trend certainly came to stay as throughout time many more solutions are being built, more people are joining WEB3 and more governments are joining this world with regulations and Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC).

If you reader decide now to join this new era, it is interesting to review how WEB3 applications vary from one Blockchain to another by taking into consideration the [Blockchain trilemma](https://mirror.xyz/hashirama256.eth/_hw5Xjvq3igjBufRkoAG85G0rPkGGdMlRmE2ABV53Eo). Among other characteristics, you can evaluate an application based on the Blockchain it is attached with and decide if it is worth using it or not. If you decide to use it but don't know how to start, in the **next post I will teach you how to surf on the internet WEB3.**

title: WEB 3
body:
## Table of Content

* **Introduction**
* **What is WEB3**
  * Why is WEB3 important?
* **WEB3 Applications**
  * DeFi
  * NFT
  * DAO
* **WEB3 Growth in Numbers**
  * DeFi
  * NFT
* **Business Use Cases**
* **Conclusion**

## Introduction

In this post, which I will talk about WEB3 Applications, I would say that you don't have to know nothing specific to blockchain to understand the it all. On the end of the day WEB3 applications will evolve to a point that they will be transparent to end users, which means they could easily be used my majority of people without any specific previous knowledge. This is the only way the mass audience will be reached and my mission here is to help get to this stage.

I just would like to mention that, as shown on previous post, WEB3 is possible due to the technology emerged by Ethereum: automated actions coded on Blockchain (Smart Contracts). The main most popular applications so far are related to finance and authentication and here is our start point.

## What is WEB3?

**Simple answer:** Instead of an internet monopolized by large technology companies, Web3 embraces decentralization and is being built, operated, and owned by its users. **Web3 puts power in the hands of individuals rather than corporations.**

### Why is WEB3 important?

Just like Industrial Revolution, the WEB has been through different stages throughout its history. Let's take a look in how we got here in order to understand why WEB3:

**Web 1.0: Read-Only (1990-2004)**

The first drafts of the internet had the intention to create open and decentralized protocols that allowed information-sharing from anywhere on Earth. The actual main results were **static websites owned by companies and there was close to zero interaction between users**, since individuals seldom produced content, leading to it being known as the read-only web.

**Web 2.0: Read-Write (2004-now)**

The Web 2.0 period began in 2004 with the emergence of social media platforms. **Instead of only companies providing content to users, the users also began to provide platforms to share user-generated content and engage in user-to-user interactions.** As more people came online, a handful of top companies began to control a disproportionate amount of the traffic and value generated on the web. **Web 2.0 also birthed the advertising-driven revenue model**. While users could create content, they didn't own it or benefit from its monetization.

**Web 3.0: Read-Write-Own**

The idea of WEB3 was created by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood. He put into words a solution for a problem that many early crypto adopters felt: the internet required too much trust. That is, most of the internet that people know and use today relies on trusting a handful of private companies to act in the public's best interests. **At its core, Web3 uses blockchain's trust value to create applications that give power back to the users in the form of ownership.** The network gives ownership to users by being:

* **Decentralized:** instead of large swathes of the internet controlled and owned by centralized entities, ownership gets distributed amongst its builders and users.
* **Permissionless**: everyone has equal access to participate in Web3, and no one gets excluded.
* **Embedded with native payments:** it uses cryptocurrency for spending and sending money online instead of relying on the outdated infrastructure of banks and payment processors.
* **Trustless:** it operates using incentives and economic mechanisms instead of relying on trusted third-parties.

## WEB 3 Applications

Now that you understand the core values of WEB3, it is now possible to understand what solutions are being built with based on these principles.

### DeFi

**De**centralized **Fi**nance is the term used to dapps (decentralized applications) built to provide financial solutions. With DeFi, the markets are always open and there are no centralized authorities who can block payments or deny you access to anything. Services that were previously slow and at risk of human error are automatic and safer now that they're handled by code that anyone can inspect and scrutinize.

Here is a quick comparison between traditional finance and DeFi:

![Source: https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#defi-comparison](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V7z56Yvm5vU8yjsiCj2EK.png?height=412&width=960)

Due to the logic that can be created on Smart Contracts, financial institutions can be removed from the equation. A contract that's designed to hand out an allowance or pocket money could be programmed to send money from Account A to Account B every Friday. And it will only ever do that as long as Account A has the required funds. No one can change the contract and add Account C as a recipient to steal funds.

There's a decentralized alternative to most financial services and also financial products that are completely new created due to blockchain capabilities. This is an ever-growing list:

* [Send money around the globe](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#send-money)
* [Stream money around the globe](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#stream-money)
* [Access stable currencies](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#stablecoins)
* [Borrow funds with collateral](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#lending)
* [Borrow without collateral](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#flash-loans)
* [Start crypto savings](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#saving)
* [Trade tokens](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#swaps)
* [Grow your portfolio](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#investing)
* [Fund your ideas](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#crowdfunding)
* [Buy insurance](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#insurance)
* [Manage your portfolio](https://ethereum.org/en/defi/#aggregators)

To understand better the how it works and the players involved in DeFi, you can separate the environment into 4 layers:

1. The blockchain – Ethereum contains the transaction history and state of accounts.
2. The assets – [ETH](https://ethereum.org/en/eth/) and the other tokens (currencies).
3. The protocols – [smart contracts](https://ethereum.org/en/glossary/#smart-contract) that provide the functionality, for example a service that allows for decentralized lending of assets.
4. [The applications](https://ethereum.org/en/dapps/) – the products we use to manage and access the protocols.

### NFT

**N**on-**F**ungible **T**okens are tokens running in a specific compatible blockchain that have an **infungible** format and that **allows to have some kind of media on their content**. Their goal is to represent the ownership of unique items and currently they are commonly used to represent digital collectibles.

* **Infungible**

  Cryptocurrencies are tokens created in a fungible format that allows the exchange of a cryptocurrency by the same cryptocurrency. For example a bitcoin that could be exchanged to any other bitcoin and both leave with the same value.

  For a Non-Fungible asset you don't have an exact pair of it that could be considered the exact same value (they can be similar values) because of different characteristics it carries. Making a parallel to houses, two very similar houses don't have the same exact value due to due to different characteristics, such as previous owners, condition of the house, etc.
* **Media carry**

  One of the NFTs properties is that it allows us *tokenise* things like art, collectibles, even real estate. Along with that, it can only have one official owner at a time and they're secured by the running blockchain, which means no one can modify the record of ownership or copy/paste a new NFT into existence.

![Overview of a NFT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vqpxZwbZsDpTh-PE5NGfY.png?height=352&width=539)

**The value of a NFT**

We are entering the transition to the era where we value assets more digital assets than physical assets (and this is called the Metaverse). You don't have to think about virtual lands to understand that, but instead think about how you value your cellphones, how gamers value skins within games, etc.

When it comes to copying digital content available on the internet for free instead of buying something, remember that value is subjective. If you were offered replica of Mona Lisa's painting for free, would you feel it has the same value as the original one? Just like Mona Lisa's painting, the value of an NFT goes beyond the media: there are labels of creator, current owner and market history.

It is also important to understand that NFTs are not just used as scarce assets, but also they can be used as utility items to develop a variety of business models. For example: holding a specific NFT allows you to buy clothes for a cheaper price, have access to a specific clothing collection, attend to private events, etc. Below it is listed some examples of use cases:

* [Digital content](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nfts-for-creators)
* [Gaming items](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nft-gaming)
* [Domain names](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nft-domains)
* [Physical items](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nft-physical-items)
* [Investments and collateral](https://ethereum.org/en/nft/#nfts-and-defi)

### DAO

**D**ecentralized **A**utonomous **O**rganizations are groups organized in a democratic way that allows members to directly vote into the group decisions by proposals and ensure everyone in the organization has a voice. 

Being straight forward, its goal is to be a company with a decentralized modus operandi. They are able to do that due to **Smart Contract capabilities** of creating built-in treasuries that no one has the authority to access without the approval of the group. There's no CEO who can authorize spending based on their own whims and no chance of a dodgy CFO manipulating the books. Everything is out in the open and the rules around spending are baked into the DAO via its code.

There are different models for DAO membership, with different voting mechanisms and other key parts:

* **Token-based membership**

  Simply holding a specific token grants access to voting. Depending on each project, to earn a token you can get on decentralized marketplaces or through liquidity provisioning or some other “proof-of-work”.

  Typically used to govern broad decentralized protocols and/or tokens themselves.
* **Share-based membership**

  Any prospective members can submit a proposal to join the DAO, usually offering a tribute of some value in the form of tokens or work. Shares represent direct voting power and ownership and members can exit at any time with their proportionate share of the treasury.

  Typically used for more closer-knit, human-centric organizations like charities, worker collectives, and investment clubs. Can also govern protocols and tokens as well.
* **Reputation-based membership**

  Reputation represents proof of participation and grants voting power in the DAO. Unlike token or share-based membership, reputation-based DAOs don't transfer ownership to contributors. Reputation cannot be bought, transferred or delegated; DAO members must earn reputation through participation. On-chain voting is permissionless and prospective members can freely submit proposals to join the DAO and request to receive reputation and tokens as a reward in exchange for their contributions.

  Typically used for decentralized development and governance of protocols and dApps, but also well suited to a diverse set of organizations like charities, worker collectives, investment clubs, etc.

If in one hand you have the visibility and system that prevents robbery, on the other hand you have open sensible data that companies would rather let it private. If in one hand you have people in the whole company having voice on companies decisions, on the other hand you have decisions that are better to be made by senior managers instead of a democratic voting of non-specialized people. 

This new way of organizing companies is a new paradigm and lots of discussions happen in this way. The creator of Ethereum himself writes a lot about this topic on his [personal blog](https://vitalik.ca/index.html). 

## WEB3 Growth in Numbers

Below I provide some links to internet available charts related to WEB3 statistics.

### DeFi

* DeFi Users Over Time (Ethereum)

![https://dune.com/queries/2972/5739](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O1OYmbKIFVWJuLDdArnBM.png?height=332&width=1884)

* Decentralized Exchangers Metrics

![https://dune.com/hagaetc/dex-metrics](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yKWQyf7RiwVq_yyKjKCjt.png?height=483&width=1884)

### NFT

* OpenSea Users Over Time (Ethereum)

![https://dune.com/rchen8/opensea](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OAiKA2eqybIVcp2LnZLMO.png?height=382&width=933)

## Business Use Cases

WEB3 is not the only thing emerging based on blockchain technology; [traditional markets](https://www.blockdata.tech/blog/general/81-of-the-top-100-public-companies-are-using-blockchain-technology) are also taking advantage of this. They are reinventing their business by not only adapting to WEB3 solutions, such as DeFi, but also by creating value with blockchain core capabilities. Among several applications that are being developed, I would like to highlight [SAP's solution green-token](https://www.green-token.io/).

Green Token by SAP is a system that enhances companies efforts on tracking production chain and is able to determine whether it was produced with the sustainable characteristics desired. By applying **NFT principles into the logistics system**, it is possible to track each phase of production chain on production supplier. It not only helps with the conscious consumption of people and with the trust between companies and their suppliers, but also enables a faster and cheaper way to audit reporting and fixing issues along the production chain.

## Conclusion

WEB3 is slowly being incremented in people's lives and being braked by current world economic scenario with high inflation and high interest rates. Since high interest rates tend to puncture bubbles, it will be interesting seeing many outstanding solutions overcome this period, increasing people's confidence in them, and many other solutions disappear, proving to be a bubble. In the general WEB3 scenario, I think that this trend certainly came to stay as throughout time many more solutions are being built, more people are joining WEB3 and more governments are joining this world with regulations and Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDC).

If you reader decide now to join this new era, it is interesting to review how WEB3 applications vary from one Blockchain to another by taking into consideration the [Blockchain trilemma](https://mirror.xyz/hashirama256.eth/_hw5Xjvq3igjBufRkoAG85G0rPkGGdMlRmE2ABV53Eo). Among other characteristics, you can evaluate an application based on the Blockchain it is attached with and decide if it is worth using it or not. If you decide to use it but don't know how to start, in the **next post I will teach you how to surf on the internet WEB3.**

## Posted on May 8 (second post)

The pub was practically empty. A candle burned on every table. David Bowie played in the background and the scent of air freshener crept from the washrooms near my booth where Leah found me.

"Hello," Leah sat down and leaned over the table to kiss me. "What are...we drinking?"

The server snuck up beside us. "What can I get you?"

"Two black coffees please, with milk on the side," I said.

"Would that be all?"

"Yes, thank you.”

The server scurried away as silently as she appeared.

"I'm so…sleepy today," Leah rolled up her sleeves. I pretended to read the menu, my mind still on William.

"So, what's that thing?" Leah said.

"What?"

"That...that thing you had to tell me."

"Yeah," I said. The server returned with a ceramic milk pourer. "The weirdest thing happened." My eyes squinted.

"What happened?" Leah said.

"Last night, I told William he had to move out," I paused, unsure how to say the next part.

"Okay.”

"He was drunk. And got violent," I shook my head.

"What?" Leah said, shocked.

"I told him he had to move out, and then he got angry, and pushed me," I said.

"Oh my God," Leah's eyes widened.

I ripped my napkin into long strips. "He didn't hurt me—I mean, he was really drunk. But that's not the weirdest thing." I paused again.

Leah leaned in.

"This morning, I looked into William's room, and everything was gone."

"What do you mean?" Leah said.

"All his stuff—clothes, stuff—they were all gone," I said.

She furrowed her brows. "Everything?" she said.

"Yeah," I shrugged.

"He didn’t…leave a note?”

"Nope. Nothing."

"He's...I don't know. What are you going to do?" Leah said. The server returned and put our coffees in front of us. I looked down into my coffee as if an answer was there, floating.

"I don't know," I held the corner of a new napkin close to the flame of the candle at our table, teasing it. "He was paying me month to month. He wouldn't just leave without giving my key back, would he? I don't know. I just want to forget about him."

"Did you…try calling him?"

"I emailed him, but nothing," I took a sip from my coffee and held my eyes on Leah from over the rim of the cup.

"So strange," she said.

I held the napkin closer to the flame.

"My cousin disappeared back in high school," Leah said. "She was gone for like a…a whole summer, then one day she just came home. We were all pissed at her."

I noticed that Leah was speaking comfortably and keeping eye contact. She was changing from the timid girl I had met. Her face was glowing, and I felt good knowing it was because of us.

"So does this mean I get...get to move in early?" she joked.

"What?" I said, "Oh, yes—no problem. But I'm a little worried, you know. What if he comes back?"

The corner of the napkin caught fire. As I tried to blow it out, the napkin unraveled from its folds and the flames spread.

"Oh my God!" Leah yelped.

I dropped the flaming napkin on the ground and it drifted against the wall. I jumped up and stomped out the flame—little embers rose into the air. The server rushed in.

"Sorry, it was the candle," I said, guilty.

The server eyed the half burnt napkin, making sure all the embers were doused. "I'll clean that up," she gave me a look and left. The smell of burnt paper hung in the air.

title: 八年抗战
body:
转眼中国防疫已经过去了三年，听说中国首都北京要继续执行同样政策在接下来的五年，这么看至少就是八年了。不知这是否也意味着老习至少再连一个五年已经稳了？亦或仅仅只是老蔡在表忠心？

人生有几个八年。多少孩子还没有看看正常的世界，不知道在这种环境下长大的一代会形成怎样的世界观和价值观。当然，还有多少梦想在这期间逐渐消散，沦为酒后谈资。

无论时间更长或是有所缩短，这一段时间的经历都会在此时位于大陆的人之生命中留下狠狠的一笔，其结果我没有预期，希望数年之后能看到规律并有新的感悟。

title: 半年NFT经验总结
body:
最近熊市歇了大半个月，想了一下还是总结一下过去半年玩NFT的经历以及个人理解吧。

经历:

大概是去年12月开始接触NFT，去年4月接触的币圈，也算对NFT有一点点的认知，但是对市场完全没有预估。就跟风买了俩一个冰淇淋和一个川普鸭（与朋友合资），投入大概1000u，为自己的认知买单，冰淇淋发售完直接rug，川普鸭是慢慢归零。1000u对于那个时候的我仓位占比近20%了。算是一个惨痛的教训，然后开始走向小资金新手存:肝白名单，那个时候的白名单还没有形成现在的工作室承包制，个人获取白名单还算轻松。凭借我的资源整合能力（闲鱼+米画师）找了不少画师画项目二创，加上我和一个嗨奴（30/h）刷活跃度。还是撸到了一些白名单的，但是后面行情不好以及项目方的各种脑瘫操作导致我肝的白名单全部破发，没破发的也就只有200u不到的微薄利润（指wabisabi，发售前白名单市场价650u左右）其实当时我如果全部白名单出掉的话，一个月的成果差不多可以卖2000u，但是对于市场的认知度不够以及肝白名单的时候对项目产生了感情（纯傻逼）导致我抱有天真的幻想。

至此，肝白名单的历程告一段落，后面还是肝中了一些好项目的，比如老王。总结就是，肝白不要带感情，该出白保本就出，发售情况不好的mint要谨慎，刷活跃度该找嗨奴就找，多开小号，多做项目活动。

然后到了5月左右吧，正规项目基本发一个死一个，短期飞的基本靠项目方做市以及虹吸市场热度，肝白基本被工作室包场，自导自演各种活动。土狗崛起，其实我觉得土狗行情的到来也是预示着NFT市场熊市的逼近，因为正规项目大多是有着不低的发售价，mint完的人也不愿意轻易交出低价筹码，导致小资金玩家被筛选出正规项目的二级市场，而OS的总交易量又在不断下滑，买盘跟不上自然导致了卷地板的行为出现，进而使得项目破发。

但是由于土狗天然具有低价筹码的优势，在这个存量搏杀的市场可以轻而易举的做到数倍甚至数十倍的涨幅，所以土狗热度慢慢涨了起来。然后就产生了各种打狗机器人，他们的运行逻辑导致的结果就是大量的低价筹码会非常集中，看上去地址分布还算健康，但是很多地址都是同一个人持有。从而导致抛压增大，这里解释一下为什么平均持有数量会影响抛压，假设你只有一个，这个时候翻倍了，那么你的盈亏比就来到了1:1，但是你如果现在卖出了，你可能会失去后面继续上涨的利润，就算归零了，也只是亏掉当前这个仓位的100%，但是如果他继续涨，你的收益可能会到200%300%甚至更多，所以你大概率会决定hold。但是如果你有两个，上涨100%就刚好能抹平你两个的成本，剩下的一个就算归零了也不会亏，假如上涨超过100%你卖出了一个也就意味着你剩下的那个就算归零了你也是赚的，所以大大增加了你卖出的概率，导致抛压变大。还有一部分经验就是要结合k线来看，最简单的猜顶底的方式就是看筹码密集区，最好是能结合成交量一起看，假如前两次到达一个价格的时候都无法继续上涨，并且成交量是下降趋势，那就不要多想，赶紧卖出。

最近ETH大跌连带nft市场也是没有什么赚钱效应了，其实我觉得对于nft市场不太受ETH价格涨跌影响，原因是nft市场的涨幅一般情况会比较大，完全可以cover这部分影响，但是波动如果过于大的话对nft市场的打击就会比较大。我这段时间的观察来看，日振幅在8%以上对nft市场的影响就会比较明显，如果是15%以上基本就没得玩了。当然这里还有波动大导致链上gas飙升的原因。

Não confunda o preguiçoso com o procrastinador.

O preguiçoso é aquela pessoa que não faz nada. Já, o procrastinador quer fazer, se prepara pra fazer, mas não faz. Ele se ocupa com outras tarefas e o que realmente tem que fazer, não faz…

title: Today I applied as a speaker on Devcon VI
body:
This is my proposal for Devcon VI, if you have any feedback, please share it with me at yourfriends@balloonist.xyz or on Discord Balloonist#6963

**Title**

The necessity of decentralization for DAOs and DeFi products

**Description**

Most DeFi products rely on centralization in one or more areas, and there are products that have a hidden centralized authority and are decentralized in name only. Collaboration in a DAO might as well be considered a general partnership with shared liability

I will give my take on 1) When a DeFi product/DAO is so decentralized that it can not be considered a legal subject. 2) How a DeFi product/DAO needs to be organized, so its participants have no or little risk of being considered liable

**Why is your talk/workshop relevant to Devcon attendees?**

When companies are decentralized by name only, they apply unseen risk to their users, take a look at the recent events at Celcius, Solana, Bancor.

<https://twitter.com/DylanLeClair_/status/1538539508462931970> <https://blog.bancor.network/market-conditions-update-june-19-2022-e5b857b39336>

At the same time, the European regulators state that the upcoming crypto regulation MiCA will not apply when the entire activity is performed in a completely decentralized manner.

**What problem does your talk or workshop address?**

Two things: 1) decentralization can be progressive and comes with a spectrum. 2) DeFI products and DAOs need to write documentation that people without a technical background can understand.

I am now working on this for MakerDAO, all my work is public, and my initial research document is available here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/16YstWfySpyzXz5yVPprjnTJJ7vArImzqm3ROIjptVw8/edit>

**What learnings or impressions do you hope attendees take away from your talk or workshop?**

Raised awareness on DeFi products they are using and how to structure their own DeFi products/DAOs if they are establishing such products/organizations.

**Have you given this talk or workshop before? If so, why is it important to present it again?**

No, I have not. I was not able to talk about it before, as I was working for a regulator for years with a strict NDA.

**How would you rate the difficulty of your talk/workshop?**

Intermediate

**Which of the following best describes your target audience?**

Product

**Please choose 1-3 keywords that apply to your talk/workshop.**

Decentralization, counterparty risk, liability

title: NFT入门分享
body:
> 本篇文稿创作于2022年2月，算是笔者早期在“大”项目方向做的尝试。所谓“大”，因为NFT本身是个很大的方向，既要兼顾深度和广度，又要对入门者友好。整篇分享的效果还有待各位看官品鉴，欢迎对NFT感兴趣的伙伴一起交流\~

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QYe92qkpvNS_4nHYq6M2m.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这是一张由5000张数字画作组成的大图像，你觉得这幅画值多少钱呢？

2021年3月11日，佳士得就拍卖了这么一张巨大的数字图片。画作主人Beeple每天坚持画一张数字画作，最终将5000张图片集中在一张画作上进行出售，取名叫《Everydays: The First 5000 Days》。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ooq02aj2hnj2CQVNz_cWI.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

最终这幅画作经历了300余次的竞拍，落锤价格停在了6900万美元。

或许当时的买家也和你一样，隔着屏幕凝视着这张即将获得6900万美元价值的画作。

你觉得这够疯狂了吗？还不够疯狂。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hlu5RGlnt71skK7olodRo.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

一位印尼大学生Ghozali Ghozalo享受着简单的快乐。他每天衣着朴实，在电脑桌前拍大头照。

适逢21年NFT的风潮袭来，虚拟头像收获了天价。

小哥想，要是也把自己的大头照做成NFT，不知道会不会有人想要呢？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZYvfeCkp1ruJLdzUdQtJN.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

说干就干。小哥把这几年积攒的大头照，一股脑上传到NFT交易平台Opensea上，一共933余张。

或许是为了致敬Beeple前辈，他将作品集的名称定为Ghozali Everyday。

没想到该作品集一炮而红，每张头像的最低出价达到了0.9个以太坊。在5天时间内，这系列自拍照在OpenSea的总交易量达到了314个以太坊，按照当时价格，已达到100万美元。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SeP_BsFIBiylKAmK3DFyz.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

NFT不仅在国外备受追捧，国内的大型机构也纷纷跟进。2021年，阿里腾讯甚至新华社先后采用NFT技术，创作属于自己平台的数字藏品。

那么，所谓的NFT技术是什么呢？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eywUHsrWHNWjAE2sQYwU9.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

NFT中文名是非同质化代币，英文全称叫Non-Fungible Token。简单来说，NFT就是标识物品的东西。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W11JzHrzGnuK02Lt0wk5T.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

NFT标识的是什么样的物品呢？

首先，NFT标识的是低替换性的虚拟商品。

可替换物品是一种可以与另一种物品相互替换的物品。纸币就是一个很好的例子。一张100美元的钞票与其他100美元的钞票价值相同。

尽管有一些细微的区别，如序列号和发行日期，纸币是可替代的。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3sMO5ahTgpOa78HrEuKkQ.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

另一方面，神奇宝贝交易卡是不可替代的。每张神奇宝贝的交易卡都是独一无二的。

他们有不同的动作组合、稀有度和物理条件，因此不能相互交换。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JW1UveaQk7wRNQA1BFFM7.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这里用二乘二表格做个梳理。

高替换性商品，往往是货币和货币等价物，比如现实世界中的纸币和黄金，以及元宇宙中的数字货币。

低替换性商品，现实的典型例子有二手房和二手车，在数字世界里就是NFT。

为什么要强调替换性呢？因为天然的交易困难，该类商品往往蕴含着庞大的中介市场，用于实现交换功能。这也暗示了交易市场是NFT不可或缺的一环。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/enLzNFYIkBbctIBGAU8a_.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

此外，NFT也标识稀缺性的数字资产。

现实生活中，我们能很容易判断一个东西是否稀缺，稀缺的东西很难复制。

比如我们会认为，手绘画作和文物是典型的稀缺产品，因为就算其他人怎么仿制，仿品相对于真品总有某种瑕疵，使得鉴定专家能说明哪件是真品，哪件是仿品。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/f7IztstmHqSoi36Ot92Bw.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

但是在数字世界，轻轻动动手指就可以复制一张图片，单击鼠标右键就可以下载各种文件。

复制的成本几乎降到了0，这使得稀有的资产不再稀有，他们的价值快速下跌。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_y4CFJVN3Jp-9zXEdcv_a.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

没有稀缺性标记的数字文件，虽然也是一个一个字节创造出来的，但会被当成像可乐那样的流水线产品，这是稀缺性数字资产面临的问题。

强调稀缺性是在强调数字资产的产权属性。

人们希望提高数字资产的复制难度，甚至达到无法复制的理想情况。

虽然互联网极大消除了信息的阻隔，很多作者也愿意免费让作品传播，但作者依旧希望世界记住，是自己创造了那个伟大作品，至少可以查到。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7lRZrVkvsIwwGzvmaS3iR.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

回顾历史能帮我们更好的理解NFT。

相信大家对这张青蛙头表情包并不陌生。其实这只青蛙有个名字，叫佩佩。

佩佩最初在meme互动平台4chan上传播。网友们魔改表情包自娱自乐，并自发上传到4chan上来相互搞笑。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lAT3MBtbHJuWtUmspMEdu.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

有人花大心思制作了属于自己的佩佩。

结果一发到网上，大家都复制黏贴，把自己的佩佩传的到处都是。

创作者一怒之下，把“稀有佩佩，禁止保存”这句话，做成了图像水印。

但这毕竟不是长久之计。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9-gCY70TIcK5pXgGaz1TX.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

因为佩佩的超高人气，售卖佩佩甚至成为了一项生意。

有人在ebay上，打包了1200个稀有佩佩，一口气卖了1万美元。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fKzW4Ieeutf4J3MdPmlpW.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

其实上面的发展，反映了对于数字创作品的两个需求，一个是自己的创作别人不能用，一个是自己的创作能够买卖起来。

但细细一想，这两个需求其实是矛盾的。

因为别人不能用意味着这个东西只属于一个人，是静止的；但买卖又需要这个东西流动起来。

另一方面，别人连艺术品都不允许碰一下，自然无法替你宣传，但宣传往往是陌生人买卖所必须的。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q_mcnVu8KdLHr-vT-oTuA.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这两个需求意外的被一个电商平台解决了。

一个叫Rare Pepe Wallet的交易网站悄然上线，里面展示了各种各样的稀有佩佩。

该网站的作者此前有区块链项目经历，因此他也把这里的交易数据上链，用比特币结算。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XQ-OTXtWidLDFfpdJMUSp.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

有了这个平台，谁做了表情包，谁买了表情包，现在表情包在谁手上，大家都可以在链上查到，不会有争议。

同时，原来独享的佩佩表情包，在交易网站得以宣传和流动。

如今这个网站还在服务。虽然佩佩表情包已不如昔日火爆，但他孕育了NFT的雏形。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aAZoKnMAbGDxIIUSjLsE8.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

聊完了NFT的历史，我们来关注一下NFT的发展现状。

目前NFT主要可分为通信层、平台层、项目层的三层结构。

通信层采用区块链技术保障交易和记账的安全稳定。国内通信层产品以联盟链为主，如蚂蚁链、至信链等，以及国外支持NFT协议的公链如以太坊等。

平台层使用通信层的API，负责NFT产品的交易、展示、铸造等功能。国内产品有腾讯的幻核，国外的龙头产品是Opensea。

项目层项目指出现在NFT平台上的各种作品集。目前大部分的项目层项目呈现小作坊模式，团队规模不大。

接下来我们将分层详细介绍。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/j0vRr4SfedIKaNg6wxQ5_.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

项目层方面，这里将介绍两大经典项目，分别是加密朋克和无聊猿猴游艇俱乐部。

2017年6月，世界上第一个NFT项目加密朋克(CryptoPunks)在以太坊发布，由10,000个独一无二的24x24、8bit样式的不规则像素组成。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5nWud7Hpl7AaocxQo0DD1.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

加密朋克所属公司Larva Labs曾设计过像素头像生成器，而加密朋克也是由算法随机生成。

尽管如此，根据属类和特征数量的稀有程度，每张头像会获得不同的估价。

头像分为男性、 女性、僵尸、猿和外星人五种属类，大部分是男性和女性。最稀有的外星人属类仅有9个。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XIz-dNs3S1x_vjaxo_cqc.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

除此之外，每个头像都有独特的特征组合， 例如飞行员头盔、紫色头发、 蓝色眼影等等。

不同头像具有不同数量的特征，拥有7个特征的头像最为稀有，其次为拥有0个特征和6个特征的头像。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rDgHgf2A5tHMcFT7ZjZku.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

作为在NFT领域探索的首个项目，加密朋克开启了NFT这个极为重要的区块链应用方向，开创了NFT的交易机制，启发了NFT标准协议的确立，激发了当代加密艺术风潮，因此具有划时代的开创性意义和历史价值。

截止2022年2月19日，CryptoPunks在过去的90天内，一共销售了1300余次，平均成交价为90个以太坊，约合人民币150万元。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TK1A-Ntn4VyKGapm_9aSa.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

让我们来到下一个项目。

2021年，一套叫无聊猿猴游艇俱乐部(英文名BAYC)的NFT获得了极大关注。

该项目发布于2021年4月。和加密朋克类似，BAYC是由170个可能特征通过编程生成的头像，一共10000张。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JN9ZVdayGCGeT73QY8UhD.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

BAYC的最大特点是将这套NFT品牌化，通过明星引流、商业IP授权、售后体验优化等方面，将BAYC建设成一个人人引以为豪、团结构建、相互依赖的社区。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XT-bqmjI_NmWyDW6XDm4p.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

至发行以来，这个项目很快吸引了一批来自街头文化圈、音乐圈和体育圈的名人，包括篮球巨星史蒂芬库里、音乐巨星Eminem、国内明星如陈柏霖、余文乐等。

他们将猿猴NFT设置为他们的推特头像。得益于他们的影响力，大量粉丝加入BAYC的购买大军。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OtPf8u_bxUQ81dKD_TNgE.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

在BAYC的官方文件中，清楚交代了这个数字产品，在全球范围内享有商品传播和创作的权利。也就是说，在购买这个头像的同时，也获得了这个NFT的商业IP所有权。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kxBAcEJ5twyaq7Le7ATTg.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这意味着将可以对产品进行二次创作和商业授权，将其印在衣服、鞋子、画板等地方，作为咖啡、啤酒和零食品牌。

这是NFT强产权性的绝佳体现。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FOrBnkHyLigfcvJEBtR8l.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

根据项目方的描绘，购买了BAYC的NFT持有者将成为一只无聊猿，并在无聊猿的世界中游玩。

为此项目方设计了roadmap，使无聊猿们不断有新的体验、新的活动可以尝试。

2021年6月，所有无聊猿会收到项目方赠送的一只狗。

8月，项目方开启了变异猿机制。无聊猿可以使用不同等级的变异药水，使自己获得不同稀有度的额外特征。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VNvLznYecKiP70o7KsOnu.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

2021年6月，所有无聊猿会收到项目方赠送的一只狗。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SS3udEfpS9lJBOVb1sA4F.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

8月，项目方开启了变异猿机制。无聊猿可以使用不同等级的变异药水，使自己获得不同稀有度的额外特征。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RK-blbCTRSyypO6nSWk0n.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

每个无聊猿都可以加入内部社区“游艇俱乐部”，进行共同创作和互助讨论。

社区内的BATHROOM涂鸦板，由所有无聊猿共同创作。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ppa8IRT7EyUVh1IcDMjC0.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

根据CryptoSlam的数据，截止2022年2月23日，BAYC累计销售额达13亿美元，约合人民币85亿元，是目前排名第3的NFT项目。

尽管BAYC并没有成立DAO，但从用户自发宣传和建设品牌的角度，BAYC也可以被视为一个顶级DAO项目。

后续也有无数的竞争者在模仿BAYC的商业模式，但成功者寥寥。

或许正是BAYC的成功的商业运营和共建，强烈的集体认同，不断更新而多样的玩法，才让BAYC如此独一无二，成为现象级项目。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Jem1bTf5PqTPfb5-k-G7p.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

平台层方面，我们将介绍Opensea。

Opensea上线于2017年，他是第一个NFT综合交易市场，为用户提供铸造、展示、交易、拍卖NFT等一站式服务。

目前，Opensea已经是世界上最大的NFT综合交易市场，架构在以太坊、 Polygon等多个区块链上，覆盖艺术品、收藏品、体育、音乐、集换式卡牌、虚拟世界等多元品类。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XHJrWuBMlP848--CkEgDO.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

Opensea的创立者是亚历克斯 · 阿塔拉和德文 · 芬泽。两人分别在斯坦福大学和布朗大学学习计算机科学，并都有出售公司的经历。

2018年，Opensea 拿到了YC加速器12万美元的天使投资。YC的创始人是科技创业教父保罗·格雷厄姆。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U1ePda3JsmCARVwtu7LHP.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

2021年3月，Opensea获得加密投资机构a16z和一众投资人的2300万美元A轮投资。

2021年7月，a16z追加了1亿美元，作为Opensea的B轮融资。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UsmSbsoc5tqWGHZe9kaTw.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

随着NFT在2021年的飞速爆发，Opensea的各项指标也迅速拉升。

根据Dune Analytics的数据，截止2022年2月1日，Opensea的月交易额突破49亿美元，月活交易用户超过了54万，均创造了新的记录。

title: NFT入门分享
body:
> 本篇文稿创作于2022年2月，算是笔者早期在“大”项目方向做的尝试。所谓“大”，因为NFT本身是个很大的方向，既要兼顾深度和广度，又要对入门者友好。整篇分享的效果还有待各位看官品鉴，欢迎对NFT感兴趣的伙伴一起交流\~

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QYe92qkpvNS_4nHYq6M2m.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这是一张由5000张数字画作组成的大图像，你觉得这幅画值多少钱呢？

2021年3月11日，佳士得就拍卖了这么一张巨大的数字图片。画作主人Beeple每天坚持画一张数字画作，最终将5000张图片集中在一张画作上进行出售，取名叫《Everydays: The First 5000 Days》。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ooq02aj2hnj2CQVNz_cWI.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

最终这幅画作经历了300余次的竞拍，落锤价格停在了6900万美元。

或许当时的买家也和你一样，隔着屏幕凝视着这张即将获得6900万美元价值的画作。

你觉得这够疯狂了吗？还不够疯狂。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hlu5RGlnt71skK7olodRo.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

一位印尼大学生Ghozali Ghozalo享受着简单的快乐。他每天衣着朴实，在电脑桌前拍大头照。

适逢21年NFT的风潮袭来，虚拟头像收获了天价。

小哥想，要是也把自己的大头照做成NFT，不知道会不会有人想要呢？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZYvfeCkp1ruJLdzUdQtJN.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

说干就干。小哥把这几年积攒的大头照，一股脑上传到NFT交易平台Opensea上，一共933余张。

或许是为了致敬Beeple前辈，他将作品集的名称定为Ghozali Everyday。

没想到该作品集一炮而红，每张头像的最低出价达到了0.9个以太坊。在5天时间内，这系列自拍照在OpenSea的总交易量达到了314个以太坊，按照当时价格，已达到100万美元。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SeP_BsFIBiylKAmK3DFyz.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

NFT不仅在国外备受追捧，国内的大型机构也纷纷跟进。2021年，阿里腾讯甚至新华社先后采用NFT技术，创作属于自己平台的数字藏品。

那么，所谓的NFT技术是什么呢？

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eywUHsrWHNWjAE2sQYwU9.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

NFT中文名是非同质化代币，英文全称叫Non-Fungible Token。简单来说，NFT就是标识物品的东西。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/W11JzHrzGnuK02Lt0wk5T.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

NFT标识的是什么样的物品呢？

首先，NFT标识的是低替换性的虚拟商品。

可替换物品是一种可以与另一种物品相互替换的物品。纸币就是一个很好的例子。一张100美元的钞票与其他100美元的钞票价值相同。

尽管有一些细微的区别，如序列号和发行日期，纸币是可替代的。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3sMO5ahTgpOa78HrEuKkQ.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

另一方面，神奇宝贝交易卡是不可替代的。每张神奇宝贝的交易卡都是独一无二的。

他们有不同的动作组合、稀有度和物理条件，因此不能相互交换。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JW1UveaQk7wRNQA1BFFM7.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这里用二乘二表格做个梳理。

高替换性商品，往往是货币和货币等价物，比如现实世界中的纸币和黄金，以及元宇宙中的数字货币。

低替换性商品，现实的典型例子有二手房和二手车，在数字世界里就是NFT。

为什么要强调替换性呢？因为天然的交易困难，该类商品往往蕴含着庞大的中介市场，用于实现交换功能。这也暗示了交易市场是NFT不可或缺的一环。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/enLzNFYIkBbctIBGAU8a_.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

此外，NFT也标识稀缺性的数字资产。

现实生活中，我们能很容易判断一个东西是否稀缺，稀缺的东西很难复制。

比如我们会认为，手绘画作和文物是典型的稀缺产品，因为就算其他人怎么仿制，仿品相对于真品总有某种瑕疵，使得鉴定专家能说明哪件是真品，哪件是仿品。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/f7IztstmHqSoi36Ot92Bw.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

但是在数字世界，轻轻动动手指就可以复制一张图片，单击鼠标右键就可以下载各种文件。

复制的成本几乎降到了0，这使得稀有的资产不再稀有，他们的价值快速下跌。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_y4CFJVN3Jp-9zXEdcv_a.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

没有稀缺性标记的数字文件，虽然也是一个一个字节创造出来的，但会被当成像可乐那样的流水线产品，这是稀缺性数字资产面临的问题。

强调稀缺性是在强调数字资产的产权属性。

人们希望提高数字资产的复制难度，甚至达到无法复制的理想情况。

虽然互联网极大消除了信息的阻隔，很多作者也愿意免费让作品传播，但作者依旧希望世界记住，是自己创造了那个伟大作品，至少可以查到。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7lRZrVkvsIwwGzvmaS3iR.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

回顾历史能帮我们更好的理解NFT。

相信大家对这张青蛙头表情包并不陌生。其实这只青蛙有个名字，叫佩佩。

佩佩最初在meme互动平台4chan上传播。网友们魔改表情包自娱自乐，并自发上传到4chan上来相互搞笑。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lAT3MBtbHJuWtUmspMEdu.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

有人花大心思制作了属于自己的佩佩。

结果一发到网上，大家都复制黏贴，把自己的佩佩传的到处都是。

创作者一怒之下，把“稀有佩佩，禁止保存”这句话，做成了图像水印。

但这毕竟不是长久之计。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9-gCY70TIcK5pXgGaz1TX.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

因为佩佩的超高人气，售卖佩佩甚至成为了一项生意。

有人在ebay上，打包了1200个稀有佩佩，一口气卖了1万美元。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fKzW4Ieeutf4J3MdPmlpW.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

其实上面的发展，反映了对于数字创作品的两个需求，一个是自己的创作别人不能用，一个是自己的创作能够买卖起来。

但细细一想，这两个需求其实是矛盾的。

因为别人不能用意味着这个东西只属于一个人，是静止的；但买卖又需要这个东西流动起来。

另一方面，别人连艺术品都不允许碰一下，自然无法替你宣传，但宣传往往是陌生人买卖所必须的。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/q_mcnVu8KdLHr-vT-oTuA.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这两个需求意外的被一个电商平台解决了。

一个叫Rare Pepe Wallet的交易网站悄然上线，里面展示了各种各样的稀有佩佩。

该网站的作者此前有区块链项目经历，因此他也把这里的交易数据上链，用比特币结算。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XQ-OTXtWidLDFfpdJMUSp.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

有了这个平台，谁做了表情包，谁买了表情包，现在表情包在谁手上，大家都可以在链上查到，不会有争议。

同时，原来独享的佩佩表情包，在交易网站得以宣传和流动。

如今这个网站还在服务。虽然佩佩表情包已不如昔日火爆，但他孕育了NFT的雏形。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/aAZoKnMAbGDxIIUSjLsE8.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

聊完了NFT的历史，我们来关注一下NFT的发展现状。

目前NFT主要可分为通信层、平台层、项目层的三层结构。

通信层采用区块链技术保障交易和记账的安全稳定。国内通信层产品以联盟链为主，如蚂蚁链、至信链等，以及国外支持NFT协议的公链如以太坊等。

平台层使用通信层的API，负责NFT产品的交易、展示、铸造等功能。国内产品有腾讯的幻核，国外的龙头产品是Opensea。

项目层项目指出现在NFT平台上的各种作品集。目前大部分的项目层项目呈现小作坊模式，团队规模不大。

接下来我们将分层详细介绍。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/j0vRr4SfedIKaNg6wxQ5_.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

项目层方面，这里将介绍两大经典项目，分别是加密朋克和无聊猿猴游艇俱乐部。

2017年6月，世界上第一个NFT项目加密朋克(CryptoPunks)在以太坊发布，由10,000个独一无二的24x24、8bit样式的不规则像素组成。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5nWud7Hpl7AaocxQo0DD1.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

加密朋克所属公司Larva Labs曾设计过像素头像生成器，而加密朋克也是由算法随机生成。

尽管如此，根据属类和特征数量的稀有程度，每张头像会获得不同的估价。

头像分为男性、 女性、僵尸、猿和外星人五种属类，大部分是男性和女性。最稀有的外星人属类仅有9个。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XIz-dNs3S1x_vjaxo_cqc.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

除此之外，每个头像都有独特的特征组合， 例如飞行员头盔、紫色头发、 蓝色眼影等等。

不同头像具有不同数量的特征，拥有7个特征的头像最为稀有，其次为拥有0个特征和6个特征的头像。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rDgHgf2A5tHMcFT7ZjZku.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

作为在NFT领域探索的首个项目，加密朋克开启了NFT这个极为重要的区块链应用方向，开创了NFT的交易机制，启发了NFT标准协议的确立，激发了当代加密艺术风潮，因此具有划时代的开创性意义和历史价值。

截止2022年2月19日，CryptoPunks在过去的90天内，一共销售了1300余次，平均成交价为90个以太坊，约合人民币150万元。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TK1A-Ntn4VyKGapm_9aSa.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

让我们来到下一个项目。

2021年，一套叫无聊猿猴游艇俱乐部(英文名BAYC)的NFT获得了极大关注。

该项目发布于2021年4月。和加密朋克类似，BAYC是由170个可能特征通过编程生成的头像，一共10000张。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JN9ZVdayGCGeT73QY8UhD.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

BAYC的最大特点是将这套NFT品牌化，通过明星引流、商业IP授权、售后体验优化等方面，将BAYC建设成一个人人引以为豪、团结构建、相互依赖的社区。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XT-bqmjI_NmWyDW6XDm4p.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

至发行以来，这个项目很快吸引了一批来自街头文化圈、音乐圈和体育圈的名人，包括篮球巨星史蒂芬库里、音乐巨星Eminem、国内明星如陈柏霖、余文乐等。

他们将猿猴NFT设置为他们的推特头像。得益于他们的影响力，大量粉丝加入BAYC的购买大军。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OtPf8u_bxUQ81dKD_TNgE.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

在BAYC的官方文件中，清楚交代了这个数字产品，在全球范围内享有商品传播和创作的权利。也就是说，在购买这个头像的同时，也获得了这个NFT的商业IP所有权。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kxBAcEJ5twyaq7Le7ATTg.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

这意味着将可以对产品进行二次创作和商业授权，将其印在衣服、鞋子、画板等地方，作为咖啡、啤酒和零食品牌。

这是NFT强产权性的绝佳体现。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FOrBnkHyLigfcvJEBtR8l.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

根据项目方的描绘，购买了BAYC的NFT持有者将成为一只无聊猿，并在无聊猿的世界中游玩。

为此项目方设计了roadmap，使无聊猿们不断有新的体验、新的活动可以尝试。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VNvLznYecKiP70o7KsOnu.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

2021年6月，所有无聊猿会收到项目方赠送的一只狗。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SS3udEfpS9lJBOVb1sA4F.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

8月，项目方开启了变异猿机制。无聊猿可以使用不同等级的变异药水，使自己获得不同稀有度的额外特征。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RK-blbCTRSyypO6nSWk0n.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

每个无聊猿都可以加入内部社区“游艇俱乐部”，进行共同创作和互助讨论。

社区内的BATHROOM涂鸦板，由所有无聊猿共同创作。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ppa8IRT7EyUVh1IcDMjC0.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

根据CryptoSlam的数据，截止2022年2月23日，BAYC累计销售额达13亿美元，约合人民币85亿元，是目前排名第3的NFT项目。

尽管BAYC并没有成立DAO，但从用户自发宣传和建设品牌的角度，BAYC也可以被视为一个顶级DAO项目。

后续也有无数的竞争者在模仿BAYC的商业模式，但成功者寥寥。

或许正是BAYC的成功的商业运营和共建，强烈的集体认同，不断更新而多样的玩法，才让BAYC如此独一无二，成为现象级项目。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Jem1bTf5PqTPfb5-k-G7p.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

平台层方面，我们将介绍Opensea。

Opensea上线于2017年，他是第一个NFT综合交易市场，为用户提供铸造、展示、交易、拍卖NFT等一站式服务。

目前，Opensea已经是世界上最大的NFT综合交易市场，架构在以太坊、 Polygon等多个区块链上，覆盖艺术品、收藏品、体育、音乐、集换式卡牌、虚拟世界等多元品类。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XHJrWuBMlP848--CkEgDO.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

Opensea的创立者是亚历克斯 · 阿塔拉和德文 · 芬泽。两人分别在斯坦福大学和布朗大学学习计算机科学，并都有出售公司的经历。

2018年，Opensea 拿到了YC加速器12万美元的天使投资。YC的创始人是科技创业教父保罗·格雷厄姆。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/U1ePda3JsmCARVwtu7LHP.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

2021年3月，Opensea获得加密投资机构a16z和一众投资人的2300万美元A轮投资。

2021年7月，a16z追加了1亿美元，作为Opensea的B轮融资。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/UsmSbsoc5tqWGHZe9kaTw.JPG?height=720&width=1280)

随着NFT在2021年的飞速爆发，Opensea的各项指标也迅速拉升。

根据Dune Analytics的数据，截止2022年2月1日，Opensea的月交易额突破49亿美元，月活交易用户超过了54万，均创造了新的记录。
